name: B. Squares and Cubes
statement: Polycarp likes squares and cubes of positive integers. Here is the beginning of the sequence of numbers he likes: , , , , ....For a given number , count the number of integers from  to  that Polycarp likes. In other words, find the number of such  that  is a square of a positive integer number or a cube of a positive integer number (or both a square and a cube simultaneously).
input: The first line contains an integer  () — the number of test cases. Then  lines contain the test cases, one per line. Each of the lines contains one integer  ().
output: For each test case, print the answer you are looking for — the number of integers from  to  that Polycarp likes.
tutorial: We'll search for positive integers not larger than , and add their squares or cubes to the set if they don't exceed . If , the maximum number Polycarp will like is , so the running time will be within the time limit.The answer to the problem is the length of the resulting set.
